lines_only_in_second: Vimalakirti Sutra: A Mahayana sutra about Vimalakirti, a wealthy and prominent citizen of the city of Vaishali at the time of Shakyamuni. In the sutra, Vimalakirti represents the ideal Mahayana lay believer. The Sanskrit original of this sutra is not extant, but there are three Chinese translations, including one by Kumarajiva, which is the most popular version and the work usually referred to when this title is mentioned.
Substituting faith for wisdom: The principle that faith is the true cause for gaining supreme wisdom, and faith alone leads to enlightenment.

All people at the core of their lives yearn to attain enlightenment. But there is no teaching more difficult to believe or understand than the teaching that we can definitely manifest the state of Buddhahood in our present existence. We of the SGI have taken on the challenge of practicing this profound teaching and sharing it widely with others around the globe.
Nevertheless, even though you chant and believe in Myoho-renge-kyo, if you think the Law is outside yourself, you are embracing not the Mystic Law but an inferior teaching. (WND-1, 3)

Because living beings are entities of enlightenment, it is not something to be obtained. Because [the birth and death of] living beings are nirvana, [birth and death] are not extinguished. Emancipation already exists in the heart of one and the hearts of all, as do all phenomena.Ó

ÒThe nine worlds have the potential for Buddhahood and Buddha-hood retains the nine worldsÓ: This means that that the lives of beings in the nine worldsÑthe worlds from hell through to bodhi.sattvaÑare endowed with the world of Buddhahood, and that the lives of Buddhas are also endowed with the nine worlds. In other words, ordinary people and Buddhas are essentially the same with no distinction between them.
